evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Hello everyone. Today we're going to talk about growth mindset.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: What's that?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Growth mindset is the idea that you can get better at things through effort and practice.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: studying more?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Yes, exactly. the main point is that effort matters. If you work hard, you can improve. Let me read you the definition from t...[TRUNCATED]...belief that abilities can be developed through dedication and hard work. This view creates a love of learning and resilience.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member3
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: But some people are naturally smarter, right?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: The curriculum says I should tell you that effort matters more than talent.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member4
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: I failed my math test even though I studied.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Okay, that's tough. But with growth mindset, you can try again. Next time study more or differently.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: How do I know what to do differently?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: , to summarize: growth mindset means you can improve.  You should have a growth mindset.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member5
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Can you give us an example?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Sure. , if you're bad at something, instead of saying 'I'm bad at this,' you say 'I'm not good at this yet.' The word 'yet' is important.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: That makes sense.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: everyone understand?  It's a muscle in that way.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member6
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: anyone can be good at anything?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: There are lots of apps for meditation.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: What about anxiety medication?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: That's something you'd need to talk to a doctor about. I can't advise on that. But lifestyle changes exercise can help too.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member5
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: My parents put a lot of pressure on me to get good grades.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: What should I say to them?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: be honest about your feelings. Tell them you're trying your best. Anyway, we should probably get back to growth mindset. , wh...[TRUNCATED]...e we? Right, growth mindset. The important thing to remember is that you can develop your abilities. That's the core message.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member6
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Is there anything we should practice this week?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Yes, good question. Try to notice when you have negative thoughts about your abilities. Then try to reframe them more positively with a growth mindset perspective.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member3
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: what?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Yeah, makes sense.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Okay good. the main points are: effort matters, you can improve through practice, and don't have a fixed mindset. Those are t...[TRUNCATED]...we've covered everything. Growth mindset is about believing you can develop your abilities. That's what you need to remember.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member5
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: This was helpful.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: When things get hard, remember that you can improve with effort.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Will we talk about this more next time?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: We'll be moving on to a new topic, but you can always bring up questions about growth mindset if you have them.
